channel.title: Update on Damien Saunders
channel.description: Recent content in Update on Damien Saunders

item.title: WordPress 3.3.2
item.description: WordPress 3.3.2 is here … and it’s not to be confused with the 3.4 beta releases. Being a point release, you shouldn’t expect significant changes. WordPress 3.3.2 is a security release, which means it’s critical that you update your site. The release notefor this Media Upload – the Flash Uploader and the newer Plupload have been updated Vulnerability where a site administrator could deactivate network-wide plugins Cross-site scripting vulnerability when making URLs clickable and in redirects after posting comments in older browsers, and when filtering URLs.

item.title: WordPress updated to 3.1.4 – security update
item.description: WordPress just updated to 3.1.4 and so that means it’s time to updateyour WordPress install. Hopefully this will be the last release before we can all use. This is a maintenance and security update for all previous WordPress versions. So that means it’s a mandatory update. What’s in this release?Source: WordPress Codex

item.title: WordPress Updates to 3.1.3 – time to update
item.description: WordPress just updated to 3.1.3 and so that means it’s time to update your WordPress install. This is a security update for all previous WordPress versions so that means it’s a mandatory update. What’s in this release?There isn’t much from a user or admin perspective, but you don’t normally expect that in a point release. If you do a lot of WordPress support or development changes to the import process and media file management maybe of interest.
